sage.terrain

Class TerrainPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Group
        • sage.terrain.TerrainPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<SceneNode>

    public class TerrainPage
extends Group
    TerrainPage defines a quad tree of terrain components; each TerrainPage will have four children, either four TerrainPages or four TerrainBlocks. Each child which is a TerrainPage is then recursively subdivided into children which are again either TerrainPages or TerrainBlocks. Organization of TerrainPages into a quad tree structure like this allows for very fast culling of the terrain.

    The origin of a terrain defined by a set of TerrainPages and TerrainBlocks is at the center of the set. That is, the four children of a TerrainPage (whether they are smaller TerrainPages or TerrainBlocks) occupy the four quadrants surrounding the origin.

    The level of subdivision of a TerrainPage is determined by parameters passed to the constructor which creates the top-level "root" TerrainPage. Each child of a TerrainPage has a name field which is the concatenation of the names of all its ancestor TerrainPages, with either "Page" or "Block" appended (depending on whether the child is a TerrainPage or a TerrainBlock), with a single digit 1-4 appended to that identifying which of the four children it is. For example, if the root TerrainPage is named "MyTerrain" and the constructor parameters generate three levels of subdivision (i.e., four TerrainPages making up the root TerrainPage with four TerrainBlocks making up each of these four TerrainPages), then the first TerrainPage child of the root TerrainPage will be named MyTerrainPage1 and the second TerrainBlock of this TerrainPage will be named MyTerrainPage1Block2. Additional depth levels can generate lengthy names, for example "MyTerrainPage1Page3Page1Block4", which describes a quad tree with five levels.

    The edgeSize of the height map used to define a TerrainPage must be (2^N + 1), to allow for even splitting into quadrants. (An edgeSize of (2^N+1) provides an extra "center gridpoint" that can be shared between both halves when the TerrainPage is split in half.) The edgeSize of the heightmap must be specified at construction time, as well as the desired end edge size for a TerrainBlock leaf. Appropriate values for the block edgeSize is completely dependent on the application. In some cases, a large edgeSize will give performance gains, in others, a small edgeSize is the best option. It is recommended that different combinations are tried.

    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine by, Mark Powell, Joshua Slack

    • Constructor Detail

      • TerrainPage

        public TerrainPage(java.lang.String name,
                   int blockSize,
                   int edgeSize,
                   graphicslib3D.Vector3D scaleFactor,
                   float[] heightMap)
        Constructor instantiates a new TerrainPage object. The input parameters are used to determine whether this TerrainPage should consist of TerrainBlocks or child TerrainPages. Invoking this constructor is the same as invoking TerrainBlock.TerrainBlock(String, int, Vector3D, float[], graphicslib3D.Point3D, int, float, float, float) specifying zero for the last three parameters (texture offsets and offset amount).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the page.
        blockSize - the desired edgeSize of the eventual leaf (TerrainBlock) nodes. This is used to determine whether this TerrainPage's children should be new TerrainPage objects or new TerrainBlock objects.
        edgeSize - the edgeSize of the heightmap for this TerrainPage.
        scaleFactor - the scale factors in X, Y, and Z to be applied to the terrain.
        heightMap - the height data.

      • TerrainPage

        protected TerrainPage(java.lang.String name,
                      int blockSize,
                      int edgeSize,
                      graphicslib3D.Vector3D scaleFactor,
                      float[] heightMap,
                      int totalSize,
                      float texOffsetS,
                      float texOffsetT,
                      float offsetAmount)
        Constructor instantiates a new TerrainPage object. The data is then split into either 4 new TerrainPages or 4 new TerrainBlocks.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the page.
        blockSize - the desired edgeSize of the eventual leaf (TerrainBlock) nodes. This is used to determine whether this TerrainPage's children should be new TerrainPage objects or new TerrainBlock objects.
        edgeSize - the edgeSize of the heightmap for this page.
        scaleFactor - the scale of the axes.
        heightMap - the height data.
        totalSize - the total terrain edgeSize, used if the page is an internal node of a terrain system.
        texOffsetS - the texture offset in S for the page.
        texOffsetT - the texture offset in T for the page.
        offsetAmount - the texture offset of this TerrainPage within its parent TerrainPage.

    • Method Detail

      • setDetailTexture

        public void setDetailTexture(int unit,
                             int repeat)
        setDetailTexture sets the detail texture coordinates to be applied on top of the normal terrain texture. This method operates by recursively calling setDetailTexture(int,float) for each child (TerrainPage or TerrainBlock) of this TerrainPage.
        Parameters:
        unit - the texture unit to set the coordinates.
        repeat - the number of tiling for the texture.
        See Also:
        TerrainBlock.setDetailTexture(int, float)

      • setLocalBound

        public void setLocalBound(BoundingVolume v)
        setLocalBound sets the model bounds for this TerrainPage. This method operates by recursively calling setLocalBound(BoundingVolume) on each child of the TerrainPage, passing it the received BoundingVolume.
        Overrides:
        setLocalBound in class Group
        Parameters:
        v - the bounding volume to set for the children of the TerrainBlock
        See Also:
        Leaf.setLocalBound(BoundingVolume)

      • updateLocalBound

        public void updateLocalBound()
        updateLocalBound updates the model bounds (generates bounds bounds from the current vertices). This method operates by recursively calling updateLocalBound() for each of the children of this TerrainPage.
        Overrides:
        updateLocalBound in class Group
        See Also:
        TriMesh.updateLocalBound()

      • updateFromHeightMap

        public void updateFromHeightMap()
        updateFromHeightMap updates the vertices of all sub blocks from the contents of their heightmaps. The method should be called any time the height map associated with the TerrainPage has been changed. The method operates by recursively calling updateFromHeightMap() for each of the children of this TerrainPage.
        See Also:
        TerrainBlock.updateFromHeightMap()

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight(float x,
                       float z)
        getHeight() returns the height of an arbitrary point (x,z) on the terrain defined by this TerrainPage. If the point is between height point values, the height is linearly interpolated. This provides smooth height calculations.

        When mapping the specified (x,z) point onto the terrain, getHeight() takes into account any scale factor which was applied to the terrain height map during terrain construction. (In other words, the specified (x,z) location is interpreted as a point in the scaled version of the terrain.)

        If the specified point is not within the bounds of the (scaled) terrain, or if the specified point maps to a location with no defined child terrain page, the value Float.NaN is returned. (Note that the Java language specification states that any relational operator (==, <, >, etc.) returns false when one or both of the operands is NaN. To determine if a value is NaN, use the method Float.isNaN().)

        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of a point on the terrain page
        z - the z coordinate of a point on the terrain page
        Returns:
        the terrain height at the specified location

      • getHeightFromWorld

        public float getHeightFromWorld(graphicslib3D.Point3D worldPosition)
        getHeightFromWorld() returns the height of an arbitrary point on the terrain when given world coordinates, if the (x,z) location of the specified world point is within the terrain boundary. If the specified point is not within the bounds of the height map, the value Float.NaN is returned. If the point lies between height point values, the height is linearly interpolated.

        This method operates by subtracting the translation of the TerrainPage from the specified world point, dividing by the scale factor, and then passing the x and z coordinates of the resulting point to getHeight(float, float), returning the result of that method as the result of this method.

        Parameters:
        worldPosition - a position in world coordinates
        Returns:
        the terrain height at the (x,z) coordinates of the specified world position
        See Also:
        getHeight(float, float)

      • getSurfaceNormal

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getSurfaceNormal(graphicslib3D.Point3D position)
        getSurfaceNormal returns the normal of a specified point on the terrain. The normal is linearly interpreted from the normals of the 4 nearest defined points. If the point provided is not within the bounds of the height map, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        position - A point on the terrain whose normal is to be found. Only the x and z values are used.
        Returns:
        the normal vector at the specified location.

      • getSurfaceNormal

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getSurfaceNormal(float x,
                                               float z)
        getSurfaceNormal returns the normal of a location on this TerrainPage. The normal is linearly interpreted from the normals of the 4 nearest defined points. If the location provided is not within the bounds of the height map, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the terrain point
        z - the z coordinate of the terrain point
        Returns:
        the normal vector at the specified terrain point

      • setTextureOffsets

        public void setTextureOffsets(float offsetS,
                              float offsetT)
        Sets the values for the texture offset amounts to use when building texture coordinates. Note that this does NOT rebuild the terrain.
        Parameters:
        offsetS - The new texture offset in the S direction
        offsetT - The new texture offset in the T direction

      • setTotalSize

        public void setTotalSize(int totalSize)
        Sets the total edgeSize of the terrain. Note that this does NOT rebuild the terrain.
        Parameters:

      • setEdgeSize

        public void setEdgeSize(int size)

        Parameters:

      • setScaleFactor

        public void setScaleFactor(graphicslib3D.Vector3D scaleFactor)

        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - The new scale factor

      • setRenderState

        public RenderState setRenderState(RenderState rs)
        setRenderState attaches a RenderState object to each child of this TerrainPage, recursively, so that that specified RenderState becomes the RenderState for the bottom-level TerrainBlocks of this TerrainPage.
        Overrides:
        setRenderState in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        rs - - the render state to add.
        Returns:
        - the old RenderState, or null if the incoming RenderState is null or if there was no RenderState of the incoming type already attached to the SceneNode.
